comment: -no is also the participle/converb suffix, it attaches to aorist to form "reported aorist", another morpheme -lo exists, which is homophonous with the subjunctive and forms reported equivalents of tenses other than the aorist.
source: Holisky, Dee Ann & Rusudan Gagua. 1994. ‘Tsova-Tush (Batsbi)’. Rieks Smeets (ed.) The indigenous languages of the Caucasus vol. 4 part 2. Delmar: Caravan, 147-212.

comment: Used in negative contexts, similar to the Aorist Reported (aorist + -no).
source: Holisky, Dee Ann & Rusudan Gagua. 1994. ‘Tsova-Tush (Batsbi)’. Rieks Smeets (ed.) The indigenous languages of the Caucasus vol. 4 part 2. Delmar: Caravan, 147-212.

comment: The copula is optional for indirect evidentiality (Unwitnessed) and obligatory for Perfect.
source: Khalilova, Zaira A. 2011. ‘Evidentiality in Tsezic languages’. Linguistic Discovery 9(2), 30-48.

comment: Converb is equal to Aorist. Copula is sometimes added directly to the bare stem as a suffix.

comment: Also expresses spatial deixis “lower than the speaker”. As a result, it does not combine with first person (see page 169 on Present Definite II).

comment: Reconstructed as analytic by Maisak (2018: 158), based on negation. Reconstructed form of the lexical verb is the form in -i, which functions as Aorist, Perfective Participle and Aorist Converb.
